definition: midwife
to help/to assist
to give birth/to reproduce/to produce/product/resource/estate/property
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker
surname Shi

sentences.english: Once they left, I called my midwife.
sentences.chinese: 她們一離開，我就電話叫來了助產士。

sentences.english: I almost felt like you wanted to call this book Midwives Matter.
sentences.chinese: 我幾乎覺得你想叫這本書助產士物。

sentences.english: Finally, my midwife arrived, along with her daughter.
sentences.chinese: 最終，我的助產士到了，來的還有她的女兒。

sentences.english: Midwives must reach the babbling fool status before you foal out.
sentences.chinese: 助產士必須滿了你的小馬駒在胡說傻瓜地位。

sentences.english: A trained midwife helped save a newborn in the village of Suenebok Lhong in Aceh.
sentences.chinese: 經過培訓的助產士使亞齊村裏的一個初生兒得以存活。

sentences.english: Bridget Lynch, is the president of the International Confederation of Midwives.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特林奇，是國際助產士聯合會主席。

sentences.english: I called my midwife, who could get to our place in 20 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 我給助產士打了電話，她將在20分鐘內趕到我家。

sentences.english: Jauniwati believes being a midwife is her life’s calling, and she trains other midwives in Indonesia.
sentences.chinese: 瓊尼瓦提堅信，做一名助產士是她生命的召喚。

sentences.english: As a midwife and mother, I’ve experienced the joy of birth.
sentences.chinese: 作爲助產士和母親，我體會過新生命到來的喜悅。

sentences.english: The Comintern plaid a rule of "midwife and guardian" in this process.
sentences.chinese: 共產國際在這一過程中扮演了助產士和監護人的角色。

sentences.english: Pregnant can get regular ante-natal care from GPs and Midwifes.
sentences.chinese: 孕婦可以從GP和助產士處得到定期產前保健。

sentences.english: This legislation is as if it were midwifed from those guidelines.
sentences.chinese: 這項立法像是來自這些原則的助產士。

sentences.english: The midwife's eyes narrowed her eyes as she reached over, took the slender shoulders in her hands and shook hard.
sentences.chinese: 助產士眯起雙眼伸出手，托起纖瘦的肩膀搖晃起來。

sentences.english: Thetinkerer in his cellar becomes history's midwife.
sentences.chinese: 所以說，地下室裏的工匠是歷史的助產士。

sentences.english: Why do obstetricians and midwives still rush to clamp the cord?
sentences.chinese: 產科醫師與助產士爲何忙於夾閉臍帶？

sentences.english: The midwife cut and tied off the baby's umbilical cord.
sentences.chinese: 助產士剪斷嬰兒的臍帶並將它結紮。

definition: breastfeeding
hunger strike
to admonish/instructions/orders
to whisper to one another's ear
to judge between right and wrong/to reason things out
to follow sb closely (idiom)/to keep close to
the utmost care (idiom); to look after sb in every possible way
to undress
adopted daughter (traditional adoption, i.e. without legal ramifications)
medical doctor/physician who works primarily by administering drugs, as opposed to surgeon 外科醫生|外科医生[wai4 ke1 yi1 sheng1]
daring/presumptuous/daredevil
malicious libel/slander
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手劃腳|比手划脚
